intro: Decussocarpus mannii, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spherical inflorescences that appear in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins or open woodlands. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
